title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A practical guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones using proven scientific strategies.

title: Deep Work
author: Cal Newport
description: Teaches the value of deep, focused work and how it can help you achieve peak performance.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about a shepherd boy’s journey to find his personal legend.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A story of friendship and redemption set against the backdrop of a changing Afghanistan.

title: A Thousand Splendid Suns
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A heartbreaking tale of two women’s friendship and survival amidst decades of war in Afghanistan.

title: And the Mountains Echoed
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A multi-generational story exploring the bonds between siblings and the sacrifices families make.

title: The Power of Now
author: Eckhart Tolle
description: A spiritual guide to help you discover your true self by living fully in the present moment.

title: Man’s Search for Meaning
author: Viktor E. Frankl
description: A Holocaust survivor’s reflections on finding meaning in life through suffering and purpose.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: Explores the dual systems of thinking: fast, intuitive decisions and slow, deliberate reasoning.

title: Start With Why
author: Simon Sinek
description: A powerful book about how great leaders inspire action by starting with why they do what they do.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a woman who grew up in a survivalist family and eventually earned a PhD from Cambridge.

title: Can’t Hurt Me
author: David Goggins
description: Navy SEAL David Goggins shares his life story and teaches mental toughness and discipline.

title: Ikigai
author: Héctor García and Francesc Miralles
description: Explores the Japanese concept of Ikigai—your reason for being—and how it leads to a long and happy life.
